hi and welcome you listening to the x-22
report my name is Dave and this is
episode 1627 a.n today's date is July
31st 2018 and the top of the episode is
the entire system is imploding and there
is only one fix let's get into the
economic collapse financial news now a
couple years ago Greece ran into a
problem and they elected a new leader
this new leader at tsipras supposed to
basically go up against the central
bankers didn't really happen and Greece
took on more debt and the IMF was out
there that you was out there saying that
the problems of Greece have been solved
now the IMF is warning that the Greek
debt is unsustainable right now without
more debt relief measures Greece could
struggle to maintain market access over
the long run and what they're saying is
that they're projecting by 2022 which I
believe is going to be much much sooner
than that Greece is going to run in into
another problem and we've seen this
before now we need to remember that the
central bank they don't solve the
problems they'd like you in debt they
like the country to be in debt now they
don't want the country to default they
don't want the country to sink they like
the country to be in that limbo state
where they need to continually take on
debt and take on debt what do they have
to push they'd have to push austerity
they'd have to cut programs they have to
do whatever they possibly can so they
can take on that debt and this is what
we've been seeing and Greece once again
is going to be running into that problem
because when we look at the whole
central bank whole central bankers model
we see that it's continually working in
this way where they put countries into
debt they bail them out a little bit
with more debt they say everything's
solved and a couple years later the same
thing happens again it's a pattern and
they know this most of the other people
don't know this country's they can't
figure this out leaders they're bought
and paid for and they're continually
doing the same exact
the only way around this is to get rid
of what the central banking system the
economy right now in the u.s. in the EU
in Canada in Australia it is completely
imploding on itself and we're looking at
all these different indicators like
housing we're looking at GDP numbers
we're looking at all these different
things and we're seeing that the economy
is not improving whatsoever and I'm
talking about the global economy when we
look at the debt we can see the debt
completely unsustainable it cannot be
sustained at all if we look here in the
United States we've been following new
home sales existing home sales and
they're all declining pending home sales
they are declining this is the summer
months this is the hottest time now and
everything is starting to fall apart
Case Shiller is out there and this is
their 20-city composite remember what
they've done they've taken 20 cities
they've had hedge funds and investment
companies purchase homes drive up prices
interest rates came very very low and
they made it look like we had a housing
boom once again by pushing the prices up
because when prices of homes move up
people feel comfortable like oh look on
paper look how much I made I feel good
let me take a home equity line of credit
out let me go purchase some goods this
is what they tried to do once again but
we're starting to see a problem it's
happening in Australia Europe Canada and
it is happening in the United States
we're starting to see a slowdown in home
price appreciation this is according to
Case Shiller we reported on this a while
back we noticed that we've hit the top
where we were back in 2008 actually were
above that and now we're starting to see
the prices of homes start to fall and
when we look at this we can see that the
prices there coming down and this is not
a good sign whatsoever because what
happens when prices come down welp all
those individuals that have been
purchasing their homes at the height of
the market like in Canada
I'm Australia in the United States well
their mortgages are set at that high
price when the price comes down well
they're going to be underwater they
won't be able to get rid of their houses
those people in 2008 that bought at the
height of the market they're still stuck
and this is just gonna make it worse and
it's not going to improve as time goes
on now a lot of these individuals might
have a short sell we've seen it before
and the biggest areas right now that
we're seeing a decline are in Seattle
Phoenix New York Detroit and many other
cities it's beginning to happen right
now and we saw this happen back in
2006-2007 leading up to 2008 the
financial crisis and what happens is if
people see the prices of homes coming
down they take the houses off the market
when people see the houses coming off
the market
traffic dries up once traffic dries up
people watch the market and they see
that it's not improving they don't sell
the homes and everything starts to fall
apart and this is exactly what we're
gonna be seeing because we're headed in
that direction actually they were
already reporting on this and we
reported on this yesterday that they're
not getting as many offers as they used
to it's all starting to dry up now in
the United States we have a major major
problem and this is a pension problem
and we talked about this before we
talked about private we've talked about
government and we're starting to see
that the pension problem is a very big
deal the pension problem that we're
talking about is the five trillion
dollar pension problem this pension
problem is the size of Japan's economy
think about this for a second here how
big this is
so state and local pension plans in the
u.s. now have less than three-quarters
of the money they need to meet their
promised payouts their lowest level
since at least 2001 and this is
according to the public plans database
figures weighted by plans size in dollar
terms the hole for state and local
pensions is now 5 trillion if
governments don't increase taxes
convince pensioners to take less than
they were promised or divide or divert
funds from elsewhere an increasing
number of funds face insolvency in
Kentucky for example a major pension for
state employees and around 16 percent of
what it needed to fulfill its
obligations Bates on 2017 fiscal year
figures now according to the public
plans database which tracks state and
local pension funds a Chicago municipal
employee fund had less than 30 percent
of what it needed during the same fiscal
year while New Jersey state pension is
so underfunded it faces insolvency in 12
years according to Pew Charitable Trusts
study I mean this is a huge problem and
it's not going to improve for example
what happens when a pension hits a brick
wall well look no further than Central
Falls Rhode Island a city of about
19,000 350 line which was forced to cut
monthly checks to retired police and
firefighters by as much as fifty five
percent as the entire town tried to
stave off bankruptcy now the town did
file bankruptcy back in 2011 and the
financial situation is not much better
and the retired city employees still to
today are not getting their full

across the country this is going to be a
disaster and if the stock market
collapses if the housing market
collapses and people start losing their
jobs governments have to layoff and
basically trim and cut guess what
happens
the system implodes this is where we are

this the only way to fix this is to get

this is why queue is out there telling
us that this is the next move the
economy as we can see and as we know
it's being brought to the edge it's

to collapse it to control the narrative
we have two sides of the story here we

we see real estate collapsing in Canada

if you can keep them off off the market
drive up the prices this is what they

it's imploding Patriots note this Trump

they understand that this system is

numbers which
we know are completely manipulated they

and we're running out of time because

same thing with pensions same thing with

here we all need to be prepared for when

very difficult those people that have no

course what is happening here is the

listen everyone thanks a lot
